member.summary:
Property to Get or Set the cell's value.
Cells may be get or set as types: , , , , , , or .
See , , , , and for elegantly parsing sheets with unknown content.
When values, the default Excel date display format is 'M/D/YY h:mm'. Use to set a custom date display format

member.name: P:IronXL.Cell.RowIndex
member.summary:
Zero-based row index of the row in the sheet that contains this cell.
e.g. if this Cell is in Excel row 3: RowIndex will equal 2

member.name: P:IronXL.Cell.ColumnIndex
member.summary:
Zero-based column index of a column in the sheet that contains this cell.
e.g. if this Cell is in Excel col "A": ColumnIndex will equal 0

member.name: P:IronXL.Cell.FormatString
member.summary:
The Excel Cell format as a string . E.g. $#.00 or 0.00% or m/d/yyyy
Read more about number formats at https://www.ablebits.com/office-addins-blog/2016/07/07/custom-excel-number-format/
member.remarks: You can find the list of the built-in format strings in the class .

member.name: P:IronXL.Cell.FormattedCellValue
member.summary:

FormattedCellValue applies cell formatting exactly as displayed in Excel, rather than the raw numerical values that underlie the sheet.

member.summary:
An method for getting a strongly-typed cell value which may throw cast exceptions if data is not in the expected.
Throws if casting to is impossible.
Use Try/Catch or to cast cell values without possible exceptions.
See for the list of valid types.
member.typeparam: The type of .net object to cast the result as. E.g: double, decimal, float, long, int, bool, DateTime, string or object.
member.returns: The value of the cell, cast as TType. E.g: double, decimal, float, long, int, bool, DateTime, string or object.
member.exception: Cannot convert cell value to {type.Name} type. Please try another TType argument." + $" You can also use boolean properties IsNumeric/IsText/etc.. to get information about cell value type.

This conditional formatting rule sets a data bar, with the cell populated with bars based on their values
This conditional formatting rule that files the values

member.summary: Property that indicates if range is empty.

member.name: P:IronXL.Range.Value
member.summary:
Property to get or set range value.
If range contains one cell: {get} returns the cell value, {set} changes the cell value
If range contains more than one cell: {get} returns the sum of all numeric cells within range, {set} changes the value of every cell within the range.

member.name: P:IronXL.Range.FormatString
member.summary:
Property to get or set range format string.
If range contains one cell: {get} returns the cell format string; {set} changes the cell format string
If range contains more than one cell: {get} returns the format string if all cells within range have the same format string, otherwise returns null; {set} changes the format string of every cell within the range.
member.remarks: You can find the list of the built-in format strings in the class .

member.name: P:IronXL.Range.Formula
member.summary:
Property to get or set range formula.
If range contains one cell: {get} returns the cell formula; {set} changes the cell formula
If range contains more than one cell: {get} returns the formula if all cells within range have the same formula, otherwise returns null; {set} changes the formula of every cell within the range.

member.name: M:IronXL.Range.GetValue``1
member.summary:
Method for getting a range's value.
If range contains one cell then method calls of this cell
If range contains more than one cell then method tries to cast of all numeric cells within range to
Use Try/Catch to avoid possible exceptions from this method if cell content types are inconsistent or contain formula errors.
member.typeparam: The .net type to which the cell's value will be cast.
member.returns: The value of the cell, cast as TType
member.exception: Range value cannot be casted to {type.Name}

member.name: M:IronXL.Range.TryGetValue``1(``0@)
member.summary:
Method for safely getting a range's total value.
If range contains one cell then method calls of this cell
If range contains more than one cell then method tries to cast of all numeric cells within range to
Use Try/Catch to avoid possible exceptions from this method if cell content types are inconsistent or contain formula errors.
member.typeparam: The .net type to which the cell's value will be cast.
member.param: The sum value of the range, expressed as TType.
member.returns: true if the range's content could be cast to TType.
member.exception: Range value cannot be casted to {type.Name}

member.name: T:IronXL.Styles.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary:
The enumeration value indicating horizontal alignment of a cell,
I.e., whether it is aligned general, left, right, horizontally centered, Filled (replicated), justified, centered across multiple cells, or distributed.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.HorizontalAlignment.General
member.summary:
The horizontal alignment is general-aligned.
Text data is left-aligned. Numbers, dates, and times are right aligned. Boolean types are centered. Changing the alignment does not change the type of data.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.HorizontalAlignment.Left
member.summary:
The horizontal alignment is left-aligned, even in Right-to-Left mode.
Aligns contents at the left edge of the cell. If an indent amount is specified, the contents of the cell is indented from the left by the specified number of character spaces. The character spaces are based on the default font and font size for the workbook.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.HorizontalAlignment.Center
member.summary: The horizontal alignment is centered, meaning the text is centered across the cell.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.HorizontalAlignment.Right
member.summary: The horizontal alignment is right-aligned, meaning that cell contents are aligned at the right edge of the cell, even in Right-to-Left mode.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.HorizontalAlignment.Fill
member.summary:
Indicates that the value of the cell should be Filled across the entire width of the cell. If blank cells to the right also have the fill alignment, they are also Filled with the value, using a convention similar to centerContinuous.
Additional rules:
Only whole values can be Appended, not partial values.
The column will not be widened to 'best fit' the Filled value
If Appending an Additional occurrence of the value exceeds the boundary of the cell left/right edge, don't append the Additional occurrence of the value.
The display value of the cell is Filled, not the underlying raw number.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.HorizontalAlignment.Justify
member.summary: The horizontal alignment is justified (flush left and right). For each line of text, aligns each line of the wrapped text in a cell to the right and left (except the last line). If no single line of text wraps in the cell, then the text is not justified.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.HorizontalAlignment.CenterSelection
member.summary:
The horizontal alignment is centered across multiple cells. The information about how many cells to span is expressed in the Sheet Part, in the row of the cell in question.
For each cell that is spanned in the alignment, a cell element needs to be written out, with the same style Id which references the centerContinuous alignment.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.HorizontalAlignment.Distributed
member.summary:
Indicates that each 'word' in each line of text inside the cell is evenly distributed across the width of the cell, with flush right and left margins.
When there is also an indent value to apply, both the left and right side of the cell are pAdded by the indent value.
A 'word' is a set of characters with no space character in them.
Two lines inside a cell are Separated by a carriage return.

member.name: T:IronXL.Styles.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: This enumeration value indicates the type of vertical alignment for a cell, i.e., whether it is aligned top, bottom, vertically centered, justified or distributed.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.VerticalAlignment.None
member.summary: The alignment is default

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.VerticalAlignment.Top
member.summary: The vertical alignment is aligned-to-top.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.VerticalAlignment.Center
member.summary: The vertical alignment is centered across the height of the cell.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.VerticalAlignment.Bottom
member.summary: The vertical alignment is aligned-to-bottom.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.VerticalAlignment.Justify
member.summary:
When text direction is horizontal: the vertical alignment of lines of text is distributed vertically, where each line of text inside the cell is evenly distributed across the height of the cell, with flush top and bottom margins.
When text direction is vertical: similar behavior as horizontal justification. The alignment is justified (flush top and bottom in this case).
For each line of text, each line of the wrapped text in a cell is aligned to the top and bottom (except the last line). If no single line of text wraps in the cell, then the text is not justified.

member.name: F:IronXL.Styles.VerticalAlignment.Distributed
member.summary:
When text direction is horizontal: the vertical alignment of lines of text is distributed vertically, where each line of text inside the cell is evenly distributed across the height of the cell, with flush top
When text direction is vertical: behaves exactly as distributed horizontal alignment.
The first words in a line of text (appearing at the top of the cell) are flush with the top edge of the cell, and the last words of a line of text are flush with the bottom edge of the cell, and the line of text is distributed evenly from top to bottom.

member.name: T:IronXL.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
IronXL is a comprehensive Excel class library for C# and .Net developers.
IronXL allows .net applications and websites to read, create, edit and save Excel XLS and XLSX documents. It can also save, edit and load JSON, CSV and other delimited spreadsheet files.
This Excel library does not rely on Excel.Interop and can be used on .Net Framework 4.5+, Core, Xamarin, Mobile and Mono projects as a comprehensive way to work with the Excel file format.
For full documentation please refer to https://ironsoftware.com/csharp/excel/

member.name: T:IronXL.WorkBook
member.summary: Class that stands for a whole Excel file. This is the first object most users will construct whether they are reading or writing a workbook. It is also the top level (home-base) object for creating new sheets and most other Excel programming operations.

member.name: M:IronXL.WorkBook.EvaluateAll
member.summary: Loops over all cells in all sheets of the associated workbook. For cells that contain formulas, their formulas are evaluated, and the results are saved. These cells remain as formula cells. For cells that do not contain formulas, no changes are made.
